page.title: 11SEWSTERN VILLAGE
page.content: Sewstern is a small pleasant friendly village, part of the Parish of Buckminster. Mainly a farming community with a population of approx. 270 people and consisting of 63 houses. Buckminster Trust Estate is the main land owners, but just over half the houses in the village are privately owned. The area was once dependent upon the open quarry Iron Ore Extraction Industry but all this finished in the early 1970's. Evidence of this is still to be seen with open quarries overgrown with shrubs and trees and the lay and colour of the Land. Some employment for the villagers comes from the local farms, the Industrial Estate and local landowners, but in the main they have to travel to Leicester, Melton Mowbray and Grantham areas.
